head.supplied: Club House Hotel ¶ Murwillumbah ¶ 15/11/96. ¶ ¶ […] ¶ ¶ With this I shall forward flowering specimens of N ¶ ro ¶ . 864 ¶ Davidsonia pruriens ¶ ? When I forwarded specimens of this species ¶ ¶ s...

div.p: MRS 203/5, Inwards correspondence — special bundles, 1886-1921, 96/1098 Archives of the Powerhouse Museum, Sydney

With this I shall forward flowering specimens of N ro . 864 Davidsonia pruriens ? When I forwarded specimens of this species some years ago, during my first visit to the Tweed River, [1891?] Baron von Muller at the time was strongly inclined to look upon the specimens as a new species, and had actually proposed to name it after Lord Jersey, who was then on the eve of taking his departure from N.S.Wales. My representation of the fact, that the tree being so numerous and so conspicuous on almost every roadside, and that on that account I could not imagine that former collectors, especially Mr. Fawcett could have overlooked the tree, may have induced or anyhow influenced him not to pursue the subject any further, then stating that the flowering specimens recieved [sic] through me, (from the department) were in better condition than any he had recieved
sic.
before. Some time ago he returned to the subject again, requesting me, at the proper season to get as good material as possible again, for closer investigation. […]
